revised_title: Experiments on Land Carriage Efficiency by William Petty
tldr: In this article, William Petty proposes a series of experiments to understand and improve land carriage efficiency. He compares the costs and capabilities of different modes of land transportation, such as carts, wagons, and horses, and suggests various tests to determine the optimal design and performance of carriages and wheels. Petty's experiments aim to improve the understanding of land transportation and contribute to the development of more efficient and effective means of carrying goods and people.
